00031 
00032 /*
00033 ===============================================================================
00034 egs_octree: an octree implementation to the egs++ geometry collection.
00035 ===============================================================================
00036 
00037 An octree is a way to partition space in a tree-like fashion, and it is a direct
00038 extension of binary trees to 3D. The idea is to start with a cuboid and divide
00039 it in half along each of the three cartesian axes to yield 8 children cuboids
00040 (hence the name "octree"), and so on recursively until some desired limit. One
00041 can restrict this subdivision scheme for any branch of the octree to obtain
00042 leaf cells of varying size: the resolution of the octree can vary spatially.
00043 
00044 The main motivation for coding an egs++ octree geometry is to increase the
00045 performance of large voxelized geometries such as a the human phantom. If we
00046 imagine individual voxels in the phantom to be the leaves of the octree, then we
00047 can merge voxels of same medium into larger cells and significantly reduce the
00048 overall number of regions, thus reducing the number of howfar calls.
00049 
00050 The geometry can handle multiple bounding boxes in order to model different part
00051 of the geometry at different resolutions (see example below). This can be used
00052 to model micromatrices, for example.
00053 
00054 Any egs++ geometry can be "octreefied". One defines a child geometry, a bounding
00055 box and the desired resolution, and the geometry will grow and prune the octree
00056 accordingly; the child geometry is simply used as an oracle that returns the
00057 local medium index for a given point. This approach allows one to use any
00058 existing input file and wrap an octree around it, so in effect in can also serve
00059 as a generic voxelizer (there is an option to disable pruning).
00060 
00061 More documentation will follow in the code, but you should be able to try it
00062 right away with your own geometries, following the examples I will commit to
00063 the egs++/geometry/examples. Please take it out for a spin on your own favorite
00064 geometry and let me know if it works well.
00065 
00066 Enjoy.
00067 
00068 
00069 ===============================================================================
00070 EXAMPLE:
00071 ===============================================================================
00072 
00073 Here is a simple example that defines a sphere and then models it with an octree
00074 in which the positive octant features a higher resolution:
00075 
00076 :start geometry definition:
00077 
00078     :start geometry:
00079         library         = egs_spheres
00080         name            = my_sphere
00081         :start media input:
00082             media       = my_medium
00083         :stop media input:
00084         midpoint        = 0 0 0
00085         radii           = 0.9
00086     :stop geometry:
00087 
00088     :start geometry:
00089         library         = egs_octree
00090         name            = my_octree
00091         :start octree box:
00092             box min     = -1 -1 -1
00093             box max     = 1 1 1
00094             resolution  = 32 32 32
00095         :stop octree box:
00096         :start octree box:
00097             box min     = 0 0 0
00098             box max     = 1 1 1
00099             resolution  = 128 128 128
00100         :stop octree box:
00101         child geometry  = my_sphere
00102     :stop geometry:
00103 
00104      simulation geometry = my_octree
00105 
00106 :stop geometry definition:
00107 
00108 
00109 ===============================================================================
00110 PERFORMANCE:
00111 ===============================================================================
00112 
00113 I tested the octree geometry on the fax06 human phantom to check what kind of
00114 gains can be achieved. Using the howfar time test from the geometry tester, I
00115 found the following:
00116 
00117 fax06 human phantom:
00118 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00119 model        # cells    avg cell size    avg # steps     time / sample (on tux)
00120 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00121 voxels     141716520             0.12            284             14 us
00122 octree       9045359             0.30             46             20 us
00123 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00124 GAIN            94 %                            84 %             32 %
00125 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00126 
00127 There is a major gain in the number of cells and the number of howfar calls,
00128 but the performance increase is mitigated by the more intricate logic for
00129 navigating in the octree (finding neighbors etc.). So the performance increase
00130 is only 32%, as opposed to the 84% that could be expected solely from the
00131 decrease of the number of steps. Of course, all these numbers are model
00132 specific, and the gain will be better for geometries in which there are large
00133 volumes of uniform medium.
00134 
00135 
00136 ===============================================================================
00137 MEMORY:
00138 ===============================================================================
00139 
00140 Each node in the final octree (the number of reported regions) requires 46
00141 bytes of memory (on 64-bit machines), that is, 38 bytes for each instance of
00142 the node EGS_OCtree_node class and 8 bytes for a pointer to the node in the
00143 region list. So for example the fax06 phantom requires about 400 MB of memory
00144 (but it shows up as using about 600 MB, so maybe there is a leak?).
00145 
00146 
00147 ===============================================================================
00148 TODO:
00149 ===============================================================================
00150 
00151 1. Add an option in the VHP geometry to represent the model with an octree, and
00152 perhaps implement a bottom-up octree growth algorithm if it can be faster than
00153 the current recursive method.
00154 
00155 2. Add the option to merge voxels when a certain proportion of the children
00156 nodes have the same medium.
00157 
00158 3. Add the option to set the resolution depending on the medium or other
00159 criteria than bounding boxes?
00160 
00161 =============================================================================
00162 */
00163 
00164

00202 class EGS_Octree_bbox {
00203 public:
00204     EGS_Vector  vmin, vmax;
00205     int         level, maxlevel;
00206     int         ixmin, iymin, izmin;
00207     int         ixmax, iymax, izmax;
00208     int         nx, ny, nz;
00209 
00210     // constructor
00211     EGS_Octree_bbox(const EGS_Vector &boxMin, const EGS_Vector &boxMax, vector<int> &bboxRes) :
00212         vmin(boxMin), vmax(boxMax), nx(bboxRes[0]), ny(bboxRes[1]), nz(bboxRes[2]) {
00213         maxlevel = 0;
00214         ixmin = iymin = izmin = 0;
00215         ixmax = iymax = izmax = 0;
00216     }
00217 
00218     // addition
00219     EGS_Octree_bbox operator+ (const EGS_Octree_bbox &b2) const {
00220 
00221         EGS_Octree_bbox b1(*this);
00222 
00223         // set the b1 box limits to enclose the two boxes
00224         if (b2.vmin.x < b1.vmin.x) {
00225             b1.vmin.x = b2.vmin.x;
00226         }
00227         if (b2.vmin.y < b1.vmin.y) {
00228             b1.vmin.y = b2.vmin.y;
00229         }
00230         if (b2.vmin.z < b1.vmin.z) {
00231             b1.vmin.z = b2.vmin.z;
00232         }
00233         if (b2.vmax.x > b1.vmax.x) {
00234             b1.vmax.x = b2.vmax.x;
00235         }
00236         if (b2.vmax.y > b1.vmax.y) {
00237             b1.vmax.y = b2.vmax.y;
00238         }
00239         if (b2.vmax.z > b1.vmax.z) {
00240             b1.vmax.z = b2.vmax.z;
00241         }
00242 
00243         // calculate voxel sizes for the two boxes
00244         EGS_Float dx1 = (b1.vmax.x-b1.vmin.x)/b1.nx;
00245         EGS_Float dy1 = (b1.vmax.y-b1.vmin.y)/b1.ny;
00246         EGS_Float dz1 = (b1.vmax.z-b1.vmin.z)/b1.nz;
00247         EGS_Float dx2 = (b2.vmax.x-b2.vmin.x)/b2.nx;
00248         EGS_Float dy2 = (b2.vmax.y-b2.vmin.y)/b2.ny;
00249         EGS_Float dz2 = (b2.vmax.z-b2.vmin.z)/b2.nz;
00250 
00251         // calculate the number of voxels in the overall box b1 (using the highest resolution of b1 and b2)
00252         if (dx2 < dx1) {
00253             b1.nx = (int)((b1.vmax.x - b1.vmin.x + 0.5*dx2) / dx2);
00254         }
00255         else {
00256             b1.nx = (int)((b1.vmax.x - b1.vmin.x +0.5*dx1) / dx1);
00257         }
00258         if (dy2 < dy1) {
00259             b1.ny = (int)((b1.vmax.y - b1.vmin.y + 0.5*dy2) / dy2);
00260         }
00261         else {
00262             b1.ny = (int)((b1.vmax.y - b1.vmin.y +0.5*dy1) / dy1);
00263         }
00264         if (dz2 < dz1) {
00265             b1.nz = (int)((b1.vmax.z - b1.vmin.z + 0.5*dz2) / dz2);
00266         }
00267         else {
00268             b1.nz = (int)((b1.vmax.z - b1.vmin.z +0.5*dz1) / dz1);
00269         }
00270 
00271         // return the overall box b1
00272         return b1;
00273     }
00274 
00275     EGS_Octree_bbox &operator+= (const EGS_Octree_bbox &b2) {
00276 
00277         // set the b1 box limits to enclose the two boxes
00278         if (b2.vmin.x < vmin.x) {
00279             vmin.x = b2.vmin.x;
00280         }
00281         if (b2.vmin.y < vmin.y) {
00282             vmin.y = b2.vmin.y;
00283         }
00284         if (b2.vmin.z < vmin.z) {
00285             vmin.z = b2.vmin.z;
00286         }
00287         if (b2.vmax.x > vmax.x) {
00288             vmax.x = b2.vmax.x;
00289         }
00290         if (b2.vmax.y > vmax.y) {
00291             vmax.y = b2.vmax.y;
00292         }
00293         if (b2.vmax.z > vmax.z) {
00294             vmax.z = b2.vmax.z;
00295         }
00296 
00297         // calculate voxel sizes for the two boxes
00298         EGS_Float dx1 = (vmax.x-vmin.x)/nx;
00299         EGS_Float dy1 = (vmax.y-vmin.y)/ny;
00300         EGS_Float dz1 = (vmax.z-vmin.z)/nz;
00301         EGS_Float dx2 = (b2.vmax.x-b2.vmin.x)/b2.nx;
00302         EGS_Float dy2 = (b2.vmax.y-b2.vmin.y)/b2.ny;
00303         EGS_Float dz2 = (b2.vmax.z-b2.vmin.z)/b2.nz;
00304 
00305         // calculate the number of voxels in the overall box b1 (using the highest resolution of b1 and b2)
00306         if (dx2 < dx1) {
00307             nx = (int)((vmax.x - vmin.x + 0.5*dx2) / dx2);
00308         }
00309         else {
00310             nx = (int)((vmax.x - vmin.x +0.5*dx1) / dx1);
00311         }
00312         if (dy2 < dy1) {
00313             ny = (int)((vmax.y - vmin.y + 0.5*dy2) / dy2);
00314         }
00315         else {
00316             ny = (int)((vmax.y - vmin.y +0.5*dy1) / dy1);
00317         }
00318         if (dz2 < dz1) {
00319             nz = (int)((vmax.z - vmin.z + 0.5*dz2) / dz2);
00320         }
00321         else {
00322             nz = (int)((vmax.z - vmin.z +0.5*dz1) / dz1);
00323         }
00324 
00325         // return the overall box
00326         return *this;
00327     }
00328 };
00329 
00330 
00331 class EGS_Octree_node {
00332 public:
00333     int             ix, iy, iz;                                 
00334     int             region;                                     
00335     short           medium;                                     
00336     unsigned short  level;                                      
00337     EGS_Octree_node *child;                                     
00338     EGS_Octree_node *parent;                                    
00339 
00340     // constructor
00341     EGS_Octree_node() {
00342         medium = -1;                                            // set the medium to -1 by default
00343         region = -1;                                            // set region to -1 by default
00344         level  = 0;                                             // set level to 0 (root) by default
00345         ix = iy = iz = 0;                                       // set octree indices to 0 by default
00346         child = NULL;                                           // the node has no children initially
00347         parent = NULL;                                          // the node has no parent initially
00348     }
00349 
00350     // create children nodes
00351     void createChildren() {                                     // create children to the this node
00352         if (!child) {                                           // ensure there are no children already
00353             child = new EGS_Octree_node [8];                    // allocate memory for 8 new children nodes
00354             if (!child) {
00355                 egsFatal("EGS_Octree_node::createChildren(): Memory allocation error");
00356             }
00357             for (int i=0; i<8; i++) {                           // loop over all 8 newly created children nodes
00358                 child[i].level = level+1;                       // increase level by 1 compared to current level
00359                 child[i].ix = (ix << 1) | (i>>0 & 0x1);         // shift up ix by one, and set new bit to that of the child index's bit 0 (x position)
00360                 child[i].iy = (iy << 1) | (i>>1 & 0x1);         // shift up iy by one, and set new bit to that of the child index's bit 1 (y position)
00361                 child[i].iz = (iz << 1) | (i>>2 & 0x1);         // shift up iz by one, and set new bit to that of the child index's bit 2 (z position)
00362                 child[i].parent = this;                         // set the parent pointer of every child to the current node
00363             }
00364         }
00365     }
00366 
00367     // delete children (recursively)
00368     void deleteChildren() {                                     // delete children of this node
00369         if (child) {                                            // if this node has children, delete them
00370             for (int i=0; i<8; i++) {
00371                 child[i].deleteChildren();    // recursive calls to delete all children branches
00372             }
00373             delete [] child;                                    // free the memory allocated for the 8 children
00374             child = NULL;                                       // set children pointer to NULL to indicate that there are no children now
00375         }
00376     }
00377 
00378     // collapse node
00379     int collapseChildren() {                                    // collapse children in this node if they are all the same medium
00380         if (child) {                                            // check that we indeed have children
00381             for (int i=0; i<8; i++) {                           // loop over each of the 8 children of this node
00382                 if (child[i].child) {
00383                     return 0;    // bail out if there are nodes below the children (this could be made recursive)
00384                 }
00385                 if (child[i].medium!=child[0].medium) {
00386                     return 0;    // bail out as soon as one children has a different medium
00387                 }
00388             }
00389             medium = child[0].medium;                           // set the medium of this node to that of the children
00390             deleteChildren();                                   // delete the children of this node
00391             return 1;                                           // return 1 to indicate that the children were collapsed
00392         }
00393         return 0;
00394     }
00395 
00396     // insideBBox
00397     bool insideBBox(EGS_Octree_bbox &bbox) {
00398         int shift = bbox.maxlevel - level;
00399         int ii;
00400         ii = (ix<<shift);
00401         if (ii < bbox.ixmin) {
00402             return false;
00403         }
00404         ii = ~(~ix<<shift);
00405         if (ii > bbox.ixmax) {
00406             return false;
00407         }
00408         ii = (iy<<shift);
00409         if (ii < bbox.iymin) {
00410             return false;
00411         }
00412         ii = ~(~iy<<shift);
00413         if (ii > bbox.iymax) {
00414             return false;
00415         }
00416         ii = iz<<shift;
00417         if (ii < bbox.izmin) {
00418             return false;
00419         }
00420         ii = ~(~iz<<shift);
00421         if (ii > bbox.izmax) {
00422             return false;
00423         }
00424         return true;
00425     }
00426 
00427     // instersectBBox
00428     bool intersectBBox(EGS_Octree_bbox &bbox) {
00429 
00430         int shift = bbox.maxlevel - level;
00431         int iimin, iimax;
00432 
00433         iimin = (ix<<shift);
00434         if (bbox.ixmin > iimin) {
00435             iimin = bbox.ixmin;
00436         }
00437         iimax = ~(~ix<<shift);
00438         if (bbox.ixmax < iimax) {
00439             iimax = bbox.ixmax;
00440         }
00441         if (iimax < iimin) {
00442             return false;
00443         }
00444 
00445         iimin = (iy<<shift);
00446         if (bbox.iymin > iimin) {
00447             iimin = bbox.iymin;
00448         }
00449         iimax = ~(~iy<<shift);
00450         if (bbox.iymax < iimax) {
00451             iimax = bbox.iymax;
00452         }
00453         if (iimax < iimin) {
00454             return false;
00455         }
00456 
00457         iimin = (iz<<shift);
00458         if (bbox.izmin > iimin) {
00459             iimin = bbox.izmin;
00460         }
00461         iimax = ~(~iz<<shift);
00462         if (bbox.izmax < iimax) {
00463             iimax = bbox.izmax;
00464         }
00465         if (iimax < iimin) {
00466             return false;
00467         }
00468 
00469         return true;
00470     }
00471 };
00472 
00473 
00518 class EGS_OCTREE_EXPORT EGS_Octree : public EGS_BaseGeometry {
00519 
00520     EGS_Octree_node         *root;                              
00521     EGS_Octree_node         **nodeReg;                          
00522     EGS_BaseGeometry        *geom;                              
00523     EGS_Float               bbxmin, bbymin, bbzmin;             
00524     EGS_Float               bbxmax, bbymax, bbzmax;             
00525     EGS_Float               xmin, ymin, zmin;                   
00526     EGS_Float               xmax, ymax, zmax;                   
00527     EGS_Float               dx, dy, dz, dxi, dyi, dzi;          
00528     int                     ixmin, iymin, izmin;                
00529     int                     ixmax, iymax, izmax;                
00530     int                     maxlevel, n;                        
00531     int                     nx, ny, nz;                         
00532     static string           type;                               
00533     long int                nLeaf, nLeafMax;                    
00534     vector<EGS_Octree_node *> tmp;                              
00535 
00536 public:
00537 
00538     EGS_Octree(vector<EGS_Octree_bbox> &vBox, bool pruneTree, EGS_BaseGeometry *g) : EGS_BaseGeometry(""), geom(g) {
00539 
00540         // combine bounding boxes to get the overall bounding box
00541         EGS_Octree_bbox bbox(vBox[0]);
00542         for (int i=1; i<vBox.size(); i++) {
00543             bbox += vBox[i];
00544         }
00545         vBox.push_back(bbox);
00546 
00547         // save overall resolution
00548         nx = bbox.nx;
00549         ny = bbox.ny;
00550         nz = bbox.nz;
00551 
00552         // set size of cells at maxlevel
00553         dx = (bbox.vmax.x - bbox.vmin.x) / bbox.nx;
00554         dy = (bbox.vmax.y - bbox.vmin.y) / bbox.ny;
00555         dz = (bbox.vmax.z - bbox.vmin.z) / bbox.nz;
00556 
00557         // pre-compute cell size inverses to save time
00558         dxi = 1.0/dx;
00559         dyi = 1.0/dy;
00560         dzi = 1.0/dz;
00561 
00562         // set octree depth (maxlevel)
00563         int res = nx;
00564         if (ny > res) {
00565             res = ny;
00566         }
00567         if (nz > res) {
00568             res = nz;
00569         }
00570         maxlevel = (int) ceil(log((EGS_Float)res)/0.6931471805599452862);
00571 
00572         // set octree cell count at maxlevel;
00573         n = 1<<maxlevel;
00574 
00575         // set octree bounds in space
00576         xmin = bbox.vmin.x;
00577         ymin = bbox.vmin.y;
00578         zmin = bbox.vmin.z;
00579         xmax = bbox.vmin.x + dx*n;
00580         ymax = bbox.vmin.y + dy*n;
00581         zmax = bbox.vmin.z + dz*n;
00582 
00583         // set cell indices range for each box;
00584         {
00585             for (int i=0; i<vBox.size(); i++) {
00586                 EGS_Octree_bbox *box = &vBox[i];
00587                 box->ixmin = (int)((box->vmin.x - xmin + 0.5*dx) * dxi);
00588                 box->iymin = (int)((box->vmin.y - ymin + 0.5*dy) * dyi);
00589                 box->izmin = (int)((box->vmin.z - zmin + 0.5*dz) * dzi);
00590                 box->nx    = (int)((box->vmax.x - box->vmin.x + 0.5*dx) * dxi);
00591                 box->ny    = (int)((box->vmax.y - box->vmin.y + 0.5*dy) * dyi);
00592                 box->nz    = (int)((box->vmax.z - box->vmin.z + 0.5*dz) * dzi);
00593                 box->ixmax = box->ixmin + box->nx - 1;
00594                 box->iymax = box->iymin + box->ny - 1;
00595                 box->izmax = box->izmin + box->nz - 1;
00596                 if (box->ixmin<0) {
00597                     box->ixmin = 0;
00598                 }
00599                 if (box->ixmax>=n) {
00600                     box->ixmax = n-1;
00601                 }
00602                 if (box->iymin<0) {
00603                     box->iymin = 0;
00604                 }
00605                 if (box->iymax>=n) {
00606                     box->iymax = n-1;
00607                 }
00608                 if (box->izmin<0) {
00609                     box->izmin = 0;
00610                 }
00611                 if (box->izmax>=n) {
00612                     box->izmax = n-1;
00613                 }
00614                 box->nx = box->ixmax - box->ixmin + 1;
00615                 box->ny = box->iymax - box->iymin + 1;
00616                 box->nz = box->izmax - box->izmin + 1;
00617             }
00618         }
00619 
00620 
00621         // determine maxlevel in each defined bounding box
00622 //         {for (int i=0; i<vBox.size(); i++) {
00623 //             EGS_Octree_bbox *box = &vBox[i];
00624 //             EGS_Float scale = box->nxtree/(EGS_Float)box->nx;
00625 //             if (box->nytree/box->ny > scale) scale = box->nytree/(EGS_Float)box->ny;
00626 //             if (box->nztree/box->nz > scale) scale = box->nztree/(EGS_Float)box->nz;
00627 //             int difflevel = (int) ceil (log(scale)/0.6931471805599452862);
00628 //             box->maxlevel = maxlevel;
00629 //             box->level    = maxlevel-difflevel;
00630 //         }}
00631 
00632         // avoid indirections for overall bounding box parameters
00633         EGS_Octree_bbox *box = &(vBox.back());
00634         bbxmin = box->vmin.x;
00635         bbxmax = box->vmax.x;
00636         bbymin = box->vmin.y;
00637         bbymax = box->vmax.y;
00638         bbzmin = box->vmin.z;
00639         bbzmax = box->vmax.z;
00640         ixmin  = box->ixmin;
00641         ixmax  = box->ixmax;
00642         iymin  = box->iymin;
00643         iymax  = box->iymax;
00644         izmin  = box->izmin;
00645         izmax  = box->izmax;
00646 
00647         // build octree
00648         root = new EGS_Octree_node();
00649         growOctree(root, vBox, pruneTree);
00650 
00651         // allocate memory to hold the region-indexed node pointers in a simple array, and free up the tmp vector
00652         nreg = tmp.size();
00653         nodeReg = new EGS_Octree_node* [nreg];
00654         {
00655             for (int i=0; i<nreg; i++) {
00656                 nodeReg[i] = tmp[i];
00657             }
00658         }
00659         tmp.erase(tmp.begin(),tmp.end());
00660 
00661         // calculate leaf node statistics
00662         nLeaf = 0;
00663         nLeafMax = 0;
00664         statOctree(root, vBox);
00665     }
00666 
00667 
00668     // destructor
00669     ~EGS_Octree() {
00670         if (root) {
00671             root->deleteChildren();
00672             delete root;
00673             delete [] nodeReg;
00674         }
00675     }
00676 
00677 
00678     // statOctree
00679     void statOctree(EGS_Octree_node *node, vector<EGS_Octree_bbox> &vBox) {
00680         if (node->child) {
00681             for (int i=0; i<8; i++) {
00682                 statOctree(node->child+i, vBox);
00683             }
00684         }
00685         else if (node->insideBBox(vBox[vBox.size()-1]) && node->medium>=0) {
00686             int shift = maxlevel - node->level;
00687             nLeaf++;
00688             nLeafMax += 1<<(3*shift);
00689         }
00690     }
00691 
00692 
00693     // growOctree (recursive)
00694     void growOctree(EGS_Octree_node *node, vector<EGS_Octree_bbox> &vBox, bool prune) {
00695 
00696         // assume node needs no refinement
00697         bool refineNode = false;
00698 
00699         // check if we need to refine this node
00700         if (node->level < maxlevel) {
00701 
00702             // check all bounding boxes to determine local refinement level (priority to boxes defined later)
00703             int level = 0;
00704             {
00705                 for (int i=0; i<vBox.size()-1; i++) {
00706                     int boxlevel = vBox[i].level;
00707                     if (node->insideBBox(vBox[i])) {
00708                         level = boxlevel;
00709                     }
00710                 }
00711             }
00712 
00713             // node may still need refinement if it intersects a higher resolution bounding box
00714             {
00715                 for (int i=0; i<vBox.size()-1; i++) {
00716                     int boxlevel = vBox[i].level;
00717                     if (!node->insideBBox(vBox[i]) && node->intersectBBox(vBox[i])) {
00718                         if (boxlevel > level) {
00719                             level = boxlevel;
00720                         }
00721                     }
00722                 }
00723             }
00724 
00725             // if the level of this node is not sufficient, set it for refinement
00726             if (node->level < level) {
00727                 refineNode = true;
00728             }
00729         }
00730 
00731         // if this node needs refinement, grow children branches (recursively), and then try to collapse children
00732         if (refineNode) {
00733             node->createChildren();
00734             for (int i=0; i<8; i++) {
00735                 growOctree(node->child+i, vBox, prune);
00736             }
00737             if (prune) {
00738                 if (node->collapseChildren()) {
00739                     tmp.resize(tmp.size()-8);
00740                     node->region = tmp.size();
00741                     tmp.push_back(node);
00742                 }
00743             }
00744         }
00745         // otherwise this node is a leaf: set the node medium and add it to the region list
00746         else {
00747             bool insideSomeBox = false;
00748             for (int i=0; i<vBox.size()-1; i++) {
00749                 if (node->insideBBox(vBox[i])) {
00750                     insideSomeBox = true;
00751                     break;
00752                 }
00753             }
00754             node->medium = -1;
00755             if (insideSomeBox) {
00756                 int shift = maxlevel - node->level;
00757                 int ix = node->ix << shift;
00758                 int iy = node->iy << shift;
00759                 int iz = node->iz << shift;
00760                 float xx = xmin+(ix+0.5)*dx;
00761                 float yy = ymin+(iy+0.5)*dy;
00762                 float zz = zmin+(iz+0.5)*dz;
00763                 int ireg = geom->isWhere(EGS_Vector(xmin+(ix+0.5)*dx, ymin+(iy+0.5)*dy, zmin+(iz+0.5)*dz));
00764                 if (ireg>=0) {
00765                     node->medium = geom->medium(ireg);
00766                 }
00767             }
00768             node->region = tmp.size();
00769             tmp.push_back(node);
00770         }
00771     }
00772 
00773 
00774     // getNeighborNodeX
00775     EGS_Octree_node *getNeighborNodeX(EGS_Octree_node *node, int ixn, int iyn, int izn) {
00776 
00777         // check if neighbor index is in range
00778         if (ixn < ixmin || ixn > ixmax) {
00779             return NULL;
00780         }
00781 
00782         // constrain neighbor indices in y and z
00783         int shift = maxlevel - node->level;
00784         if (iyn < node->iy<<shift) {
00785             iyn = node->iy<<shift;
00786         }
00787         else if (iyn > ~(~node->iy<<shift)) {
00788             iyn = ~(~node->iy<<shift);
00789         }
00790         if (izn < node->iz<<shift) {
00791             izn = node->iz<<shift;
00792         }
00793         else if (izn > ~(~node->iz<<shift)) {
00794             izn = ~(~node->iz<<shift);
00795         }
00796 
00797         // walk up and down the octree to new cell
00798         int diff  = node->ix ^ (ixn>>shift);
00799         shift = 0;
00800         while (diff & (1<<shift)) {
00801             node = node->parent;
00802             shift++;
00803         }
00804         shift = maxlevel - node->level;
00805         while (node->child) {
00806             shift--;
00807             int childIndex;
00808             childIndex  = (ixn>>shift & 0x1);
00809             childIndex |= (iyn>>shift & 0x1) << 1;
00810             childIndex |= (izn>>shift & 0x1) << 2;
00811             node = node->child + childIndex;
00812         }
00813         shift = maxlevel - node->level;
00814 
00815         return node;
00816     }
00817 
00818 
00819     // getNeighborNodeY
00820     EGS_Octree_node *getNeighborNodeY(EGS_Octree_node *node, int ixn, int iyn, int izn) {
00821 
00822         // check if neighbor index is in range
00823         if (iyn < iymin || iyn > iymax) {
00824             return NULL;
00825         }
00826 
00827         // constrain neighbor indices in x and z
00828         int shift = maxlevel - node->level;
00829         if (ixn < node->ix<<shift) {
00830             ixn = node->ix<<shift;
00831         }
00832         else if (ixn > ~(~node->ix<<shift)) {
00833             ixn = ~(~node->ix<<shift);
00834         }
00835         if (izn < node->iz<<shift) {
00836             izn = node->iz<<shift;
00837         }
00838         else if (izn > ~(~node->iz<<shift)) {
00839             izn = ~(~node->iz<<shift);
00840         }
00841 
00842         // walk up and down the octree to new cell
00843         int diff  = node->iy ^ (iyn>>shift);
00844         shift = 0;
00845         while (diff & (1<<shift)) {
00846             node = node->parent;
00847             shift++;
00848         }
00849         shift = maxlevel - node->level;
00850         while (node->child) {
00851             shift--;
00852             int childIndex;
00853             childIndex  = (ixn>>shift & 0x1);
00854             childIndex |= (iyn>>shift & 0x1) << 1;
00855             childIndex |= (izn>>shift & 0x1) << 2;
00856             node = node->child + childIndex;
00857         }
00858         return node;
00859     }
00860 
00861 
00862     // getNeighborNodeZ
00863     EGS_Octree_node *getNeighborNodeZ(EGS_Octree_node *node, int ixn, int iyn, int izn) {
00864 
00865         // check if neighbor index is in range
00866         if (izn < izmin || izn > izmax) {
00867             return NULL;
00868         }
00869 
00870         // constrain neighbor indices in x and y
00871         int shift = maxlevel - node->level;
00872         if (ixn < node->ix<<shift) {
00873             ixn = node->ix<<shift;
00874         }
00875         else if (ixn > ~(~node->ix<<shift)) {
00876             ixn = ~(~node->ix<<shift);
00877         }
00878         if (iyn < node->iy<<shift) {
00879             iyn = node->iy<<shift;
00880         }
00881         else if (iyn > ~(~node->iy<<shift)) {
00882             iyn = ~(~node->iy<<shift);
00883         }
00884 
00885         // walk up and down the octree to new cell
00886         int diff  = node->iz ^ (izn>>shift);
00887         shift = 0;
00888         while (diff & (1<<shift)) {
00889             node = node->parent;
00890             shift++;
00891         }
00892         shift = maxlevel - node->level;
00893         while (node->child) {
00894             shift--;
00895             int childIndex;
00896             childIndex  = (ixn>>shift & 0x1);
00897             childIndex |= (iyn>>shift & 0x1) << 1;
00898             childIndex |= (izn>>shift & 0x1) << 2;
00899             node = node->child + childIndex;
00900         }
00901         return node;
00902     }
00903 
00904 
00905     // getNode
00906     EGS_Octree_node *getNode(int ix, int iy, int iz) {
00907         if ((ix<ixmin) || (ix>ixmax) || (iy<iymin) || (iy>iymax) || (iz<izmin) || (iz>izmax)) {
00908             return NULL;
00909         }
00910         EGS_Octree_node *node = root;
00911         int shift = maxlevel;
00912         while (node->child) {
00913             shift--;
00914             int childIndex;
00915             childIndex  = (ix>>shift & 0x1);
00916             childIndex |= (iy>>shift & 0x1) << 1;
00917             childIndex |= (iz>>shift & 0x1) << 2;
00918             node = node->child + childIndex;
00919         }
00920         return node;
00921     }
00922 
00923 
00924     // setIndices
00925     void setIndices(const EGS_Vector &r, int &ix, int &iy, int &iz) {
00926         ix = (int)((r.x-xmin)*dxi);
00927         iy = (int)((r.y-ymin)*dyi);
00928         iz = (int)((r.z-zmin)*dzi);
00929         if (ix<ixmin) {
00930             ix=ixmin;
00931         }
00932         if (ix>ixmax) {
00933             ix=ixmax;
00934         }
00935         if (iy<iymin) {
00936             iy=iymin;
00937         }
00938         if (iy>iymax) {
00939             iy=iymax;
00940         }
00941         if (iz<izmin) {
00942             iz=izmin;
00943         }
00944         if (iz>izmax) {
00945             iz=izmax;
00946         }
00947     }
00948 
00949 
00950     // isInside
00951     bool isInside(const EGS_Vector &r) {
00952         if (r.x >= bbxmin && r.x <= bbxmax &&
00953                 r.y >= bbymin && r.y <= bbymax &&
00954                 r.z >= bbzmin && r.z <= bbzmax) {
00955             return true;
00956         }
00957         return false;
00958     }
00959 
00960 
00961     // isWhere
00962     int isWhere(const EGS_Vector &r) {
00963         if (!isInside(r)) {
00964             return -1;
00965         }
00966         int ix, iy, iz;
00967         setIndices(r,ix,iy,iz);
00968         return getNode(ix,iy,iz)->region;
00969     }
00970 
00971 
00972     // inside (deprecated)
00973     int inside(const EGS_Vector &r) {
00974         return isWhere(r);
00975     }
00976 
00977 
00978     // isWhereFast
00979     int isWhereFast(const EGS_Vector &r) {
00980         if (!isInside(r)) {
00981             return -1;
00982         }
00983         int ix, iy, iz;
00984         setIndices(r, ix, iy, iz);
00985         return getNode(ix,iy,iz)->region;
00986     }
00987 
00988 
00989     // medium
00990     int medium(int ireg) const {
00991         return nodeReg[ireg]->medium;
00992     }
00993 
00994 
00995     // howfarIn
00996     int howfarIn(EGS_Octree_node *node, const EGS_Vector &r, const EGS_Vector &u, EGS_Float &t, EGS_Vector *normal=0) {
00997 
00998         int ix, iy, iz, tmp;
00999         int crossed = -1;
01000 
01001         if (!node) {
01002             return -1;
01003         }
01004 
01005         // set shift and local cell indices
01006         int shift = maxlevel - node->level;                     // how many levels missing between current level and full depth
01007         ix = node->ix;
01008         iy = node->iy;
01009         iz = node->iz;
01010 
01011         // x direction
01012         if (u.x > 0) {
01013             ix = ~(~ix<<shift);                                 // fill lower level bits with 1's to always consider +x below current node
01014             EGS_Float xBound;
01015             if (ix>=ixmax) {
01016                 xBound = bbxmax;
01017             }
01018             else {
01019                 xBound = xmin + (ix+1)*dx;
01020             }
01021             EGS_Float d = (xBound-r.x) / u.x;
01022             if (d <= t) {
01023                 t = d;
01024                 crossed = 0;
01025                 ix++;
01026                 if (normal) {
01027                     *normal = EGS_Vector(-1,0,0);
01028                 }
01029             }
01030         }
01031         else if (u.x < 0) {
01032             ix = ix<<shift;                                     // fill lower level bits with 0's to always consider -x below current node
01033             EGS_Float xBound;
01034             if (ix<=ixmin) {
01035                 xBound = bbxmin;
01036             }
01037             else {
01038                 xBound = xmin + ix*dx;
01039             }
01040             EGS_Float d = (xBound-r.x) / u.x;
01041             if (d <= t) {
01042                 t = d;
01043                 crossed = 0;
01044                 ix--;
01045                 if (normal) {
01046                     *normal = EGS_Vector(1,0,0);
01047                 }
01048             }
01049         }
01050 
01051 
01052         // y direction
01053         if (u.y > 0) {
01054             iy = ~(~iy<<shift);                                 // fill lower level bits with 1's to always consider +y below current node
01055             EGS_Float yBound;
01056             if (iy>=iymax) {
01057                 yBound = bbymax;
01058             }
01059             else {
01060                 yBound = ymin + (iy+1)*dy;
01061             }
01062             EGS_Float d = (yBound - r.y) / u.y;
01063             if (d <= t) {
01064                 t = d;
01065                 crossed = 1;
01066                 iy++;
01067                 if (normal) {
01068                     *normal = EGS_Vector(0,-1,0);
01069                 }
01070             }
01071         }
01072         else if (u.y < 0) {
01073             iy = iy<<shift;                                     // fill lower level bits with 0's to always consider -y below current node
01074             EGS_Float yBound;
01075             if (iy<=iymin) {
01076                 yBound = bbymin;
01077             }
01078             else {
01079                 yBound = ymin + iy*dy;
01080             }
01081             EGS_Float d = (yBound-r.y) / u.y;
01082             if (d <= t) {
01083                 t = d;
01084                 crossed = 1;
01085                 iy--;
01086                 if (normal) {
01087                     *normal = EGS_Vector(0,1,0);
01088                 }
01089             }
01090         }
01091 
01092         // z direction
01093         if (u.z > 0) {
01094             iz = ~(~iz<<shift);                                 // fill lower level bits with 1's to always consider +z below current node
01095             EGS_Float zBound;
01096             if (iz>=izmax) {
01097                 zBound = bbzmax;
01098             }
01099             else {
01100                 zBound = zmin + (iz+1)*dz;
01101             }
01102             EGS_Float d = (zBound-r.z) / u.z;
01103             if (d <= t) {
01104                 t = d;
01105                 crossed = 2;
01106                 iz++;
01107                 if (normal) {
01108                     *normal = EGS_Vector(0,0,-1);
01109                 }
01110             }
01111         }
01112         else if (u.z < 0) {
01113             iz = iz<<shift;                                     // fill lower level bits with 0's to always consider -z below current node
01114             EGS_Float zBound;
01115             if (iz<=izmin) {
01116                 zBound = bbzmin;
01117             }
01118             else {
01119                 zBound = zmin + iz*dz;
01120             }
01121             EGS_Float d = (zBound-r.z) / u.z;
01122             if (d <= t) {
01123                 t = d;
01124                 crossed = 2;
01125                 iz--;
01126                 if (normal) {
01127                     *normal = EGS_Vector(0,0,1);
01128                 }
01129             }
01130         }
01131 
01132         // get the new region index for the neighbor cell:
01133         // 1) find the new position in the plane perpendicular to the crossing direction
01134         // 2) get the indices for the neighbor cell at maximum depth, corresponding to that position
01135         // 3) call an axis specific function to get the neighbor node
01136         if (crossed==0) {
01137             EGS_Vector ryz(r.x, r.y+t*u.y, r.z+t*u.z);
01138             setIndices(ryz, tmp, iy, iz);
01139             node = getNeighborNodeX(node, ix, iy, iz);
01140         }
01141         else if (crossed==1) {
01142             EGS_Vector rxz(r.x+t*u.x, r.y, r.z+t*u.z);
01143             setIndices(rxz, ix, tmp, iz);
01144             node = getNeighborNodeY(node, ix, iy, iz);
01145         }
01146         else if (crossed==2) {
01147             EGS_Vector rxy(r.x+t*u.x, r.y+t*u.y, r.z);
01148             setIndices(rxy, ix, iy, tmp);
01149             node = getNeighborNodeZ(node, ix, iy, iz);
01150         }
01151 
01152         if (node) {
01153             return node->region;
01154         }
01155         else {
01156             return -1;
01157         }
01158     }
01159 
01160 
01161     // howfarOut
01162     int howfarOut(const EGS_Vector &r, const EGS_Vector &u, EGS_Float &t, EGS_Vector *normal=0) {
01163 
01164         int inew = -1, tmp;
01165         int ix, iy, iz;
01166         EGS_Float d, tlong = 2*t;
01167         EGS_Octree_node *node = NULL;
01168 
01169         // x axis
01170         if (r.x <= bbxmin && u.x > 0) {
01171             ix = ixmin;
01172             d = (bbxmin-r.x) / u.x;
01173         }
01174         else if (r.x >= bbxmax && u.x < 0) {
01175             ix = ixmax;
01176             d = (bbxmax-r.x) / u.x;
01177         }
01178         else {
01179             d = tlong;
01180         }
01181         if (d <= t) {
01182             EGS_Float yy = r.y + u.y*d;
01183             EGS_Float zz = r.z + u.z*d;
01184             if (yy >= bbymin && yy <= bbymax && zz >= bbzmin && zz <= bbzmax) {
01185                 EGS_Vector rr(0,yy,zz);
01186                 setIndices(rr, tmp, iy, iz);
01187                 t = d;
01188                 if (normal) {
01189                     *normal = (ix == ixmin) ? EGS_Vector(-1,0,0) : EGS_Vector(1,0,0);
01190                 }
01191                 node = getNode(ix,iy,iz);
01192                 return node->region;
01193             }
01194         }
01195 
01196         // y axis
01197         if (r.y <= bbymin && u.y > 0) {
01198             iy = iymin;
01199             d = (bbymin-r.y) / u.y;
01200         }
01201         else if (r.y >= bbymax && u.y < 0) {
01202             iy = iymax;
01203             d = (bbymax-r.y) / u.y;
01204         }
01205         else {
01206             d = tlong;
01207         }
01208         if (d <= t) {
01209             EGS_Float xx = r.x + u.x*d;
01210             EGS_Float zz = r.z + u.z*d;
01211             if (xx >= bbxmin && xx <= bbxmax && zz >= bbzmin && zz <= bbzmax) {
01212                 EGS_Vector rr(xx,0,zz);
01213                 setIndices(rr, ix, tmp, iz);
01214                 t = d;
01215                 if (normal) {
01216                     *normal = (iy == iymin) ? EGS_Vector(0,-1,0) : EGS_Vector(0,1,0);
01217                 }
01218                 node = getNode(ix,iy,iz);
01219                 return node->region;
01220             }
01221         }
01222 
01223         // z axis
01224         if (r.z <= bbzmin && u.z > 0) {
01225             iz = izmin;
01226             d = (bbzmin-r.z) / u.z;
01227         }
01228         else if (r.z >= bbzmax && u.z < 0) {
01229             iz = izmax;
01230             d = (bbzmax-r.z) / u.z;
01231         }
01232         else {
01233             d = tlong;
01234         }
01235         if (d <= t) {
01236             EGS_Float xx = r.x + u.x*d;
01237             EGS_Float yy = r.y + u.y*d;
01238             if (xx >= bbxmin && xx <= bbxmax && yy >= bbymin && yy <= bbymax) {
01239                 EGS_Vector rr(xx,yy,0);
01240                 setIndices(rr, ix, iy, tmp);
01241                 t = d;
01242                 if (normal) {
01243                     *normal = (iz == izmin) ? EGS_Vector(0,0,-1) : EGS_Vector(0,0,1);
01244                 }
01245                 node = getNode(ix,iy,iz);
01246                 return node->region;
01247             }
01248         }
01249 
01250         return -1;
01251     }
01252 
01253 
01254     // howfar
01255     int howfar(int ireg, const EGS_Vector &r, const EGS_Vector &u, EGS_Float &t, int *newmed, EGS_Vector *normal=0) {
01256 
01257         int inew = ireg;
01258 
01259         // get new region number
01260         if (ireg==-1) {
01261             inew = howfarOut(r, u, t, normal);
01262         }
01263         else {
01264             inew = howfarIn(nodeReg[ireg], r, u, t, normal);
01265         }
01266 
01267         // set new medium
01268         if (inew>=0 && newmed) {
01269             *newmed = nodeReg[inew]->medium;
01270         }
01271         return inew;
01272     }
01273 
01274 
01275     // hownearIn
01276     EGS_Float hownearIn(int ireg, const EGS_Vector &r) {
01277         EGS_Octree_node *node = nodeReg[ireg];
01278         int shift = maxlevel - node->level;
01279         EGS_Float t1, t2, tx, ty, tz;
01280         int imin, imax;
01281 
01282         // x
01283         imin = node->ix << shift;
01284         imax = ~(~node->ix << shift);
01285         t1 = (r.x-xmin)-dx*imin;
01286         t2 = dx*(imax-imin+1)-t1;
01287         tx = t1 < t2 ? t1 : t2;
01288 
01289         // y
01290         imin = node->iy << shift;
01291         imax = ~(~node->iy << shift);
01292         t1 = (r.y-ymin)-dy*imin;
01293         t2 = dy*(imax-imin+1)-t1;
01294         ty = t1 < t2 ? t1 : t2;
01295 
01296         // z
01297         imin = node->iz << shift;
01298         imax = ~(~node->iz << shift);
01299         t1 = (r.z-zmin)-dz*imin;
01300         t2 = dz*(imax-imin+1)-t1;
01301         tz = t1 < t2 ? t1 : t2;
01302 
01303         return tx<ty && tx<tz ? tx : ty<tz ? ty : tz;
01304     }
01305 
01306 
01307     // hownear
01308     EGS_Float hownear(int ireg, const EGS_Vector &r) {
01309         if (ireg>=0) {
01310             return hownearIn(ireg, r);
01311         }
01312         int nc=0;
01313         EGS_Float s1=0, s2=0;
01314         if (r.x < bbxmin || r.x > bbxmax) {
01315             EGS_Float t = r.x < bbxmin ? bbxmin-r.x : r.x-bbxmax;
01316             nc++;
01317             s1 += t;
01318             s2 += t*t;
01319         }
01320         if (r.y < bbymin || r.y > bbymax) {
01321             EGS_Float t = r.y < bbymin ? bbymin-r.y : r.y-bbymax;
01322             nc++;
01323             s1 += t;
01324             s2 += t*t;
01325         }
01326         if (r.z < bbzmin || r.z > bbzmax) {
01327             EGS_Float t = r.z < bbzmin ? bbzmin-r.z : r.z-bbzmax;
01328             nc++;
01329             s1 += t;
01330             s2 += t*t;
01331         }
01332         return nc == 1 ? s1 : sqrt(s2);
01333     }
01334 
01335 
01336     // getType
01337     const string &getType() const {
01338         return type;
01339     }
01340 
01341     // printInfo
01342     void printInfo() const;
01343 };
